cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 180 miles ESE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: moving WNW across the Yucatán, then turning north toward the northern Gulf Coast (central-eastern Louisiana)
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast (around Vermilion Bay to Atchafalaya Bay)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect (watches for northern Gulf Coast expected to be issued Wednesday)
weather_observation.warning_coast: None for U.S. coast at this advisory
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from upper Texas coast eastward through Louisiana and Mississippi
weather_observation.wind: Low to moderate chance (34%) of sustained 34-kt winds late Thursday into Friday; 12% chance of 50-kt gusts
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected beyond minor tidal run-up
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of squally showers, most bands stay east of the port; heavy core rain stays over Louisiana
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated seas and long-period swells could disrupt pilot boarding and vessel scheduling Thursday–Friday
